content: You could improve it by adding tasks he did but which are not in his todo list

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Everything is clear and it's pretty fast to solve.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Everything is pretty clear, coded up a fast solution. Maybe it would be good to emphasize the 'alphabetically' by making it uppercase.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: 
1) inputs parsing is confusing (see the AlfredB's proposal to make it better),
2) the sorting constraint can make the clash hard to solve in less than 5min and doesn't have lot of interest
3) validators outputs must be differents from test cases
4) too hard to solve in reverse mode with those inputs

if you change those points, i will change my vote because the idea is good !

Nice and easy problem. On first sight, it can be a bit hard to distinguish what is in the to-list and what is in the completed list. How about reordering the input like this instead:

4
Take out the rubbish
Walk the dog
Do the dishes
Clean the living room
3
Take out the rubbish
Clean the living room
Do the dishes

So they visually are more separated.

Input section
* Please format all line numbers in bold, e.g. <<Line 1:>>, <<Next [[T]] lines:>>.
* Please format T and N as [[variables]].

Constraints section
* Please format T as a [[variable]].

Thanks.
Done, thanks for pointing that out.
Fixed, thank you for the feedback.

Fixed 1 and 4, but I didn't understand how validators worked in the first place, as the documentation wasn't clear on that part.

To address the sorting: I added it because I wanted to have a standardised order of output, because people can just print C B A instead of A B C and the test cases would decide it's wrong.
Or formatting the word as bold.

Maybe instead of asking alphabetical sorting, you could just ask to have the same order given in the inputs ? I think most of people will give them in that order.

Test cases will be visible by the players ans will help them to check them algorithm, and the validators are very similar and not visible tests wich are played when the player submit his code.

they must be différents to avoid the hard coded solutions. Here you have the same results in both with différents inputs : 
1) try to make yours validators very similar from you tests but with différents i/o
2 ) always put the harder problem as a test instead of a validators.
